reference_summary:
The After Science Fiction ['A new Amazon Original Series: From Chris Carter, creator of The X-Files. Eight strangers are thrown together by mysterious forces and must help each other survive in a violent world that defies explanation. More episodes coming soon exclusively on Prime Instant Video.'] {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Chris Carter'], 'Producers': ['Chris Carter', 'Marc Rosen', 'Gabe Rotter'], 'Starring': ['Aldis Hodge', 'Andrew Howard', 'Arielle Kebbel']} I really wanted to like this. But this isn't a show so much as a series of somewhat related scenes.

A rather attractive woman gets nude after IT happens (whatever IT is)...so if that's your thing, at least there's that. To be clear...the girl skinny dips in front of strangers after IT happens because....ratings?

I guess ratings are immaterial here. But it's just a very strange thing to shoe-horn into a show about the end of the world.

Anyway, cliches ahoy, matey! I think we pretty much have every modern stereotype covered here, and it's all terribly boring.

This show is like The Walking Dead with a much smaller budget, worse actors, a much smaller budget and a terrible script.

If you do watch it, consider it a comedy going in and you might enjoy it. I really wanted to like this. But this isn't a show so much ... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Christian Tureaud', 'David Salzberg'], 'Producers': ['Christian Tureaud', 'David Salzberg', 'Mike Boettcher', 'Carlos Boettcher'], 'Starring': ['Mike Boettcher', 'Carlos Boettcher'], 'Studio': ['Anderson Digital']} Great film, but why was the son allowed to tag along? That seems really weird and irresponsible. It's an extra person that the soldiers have to babysit. Great film, but why was the son allowed to ... {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ["Thaddeus O'Sullivan"], 'Producers': ['Julie Payne', 'Ann Wingate', 'Frank Doelger', 'Tracey Scoffield', 'David M. Thompson'], 'Starring': ['Brendan Gleeson', 'Janet McTeer', 'Len Cariou'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} I prefer the first actor, but the film is still great! A unique view on Churchill as a person {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ellen Goosenberg Kent'], 'Starring': ['Beth Carpenter'], 'Studio': ['Fisher Klingenstein Films']} Great show.

As a critical reviewer, the user emphasizes responsible character decisions and the impact of supporting characters on the overall narrative arc. Their reviews illustrate a thoughtful evaluation process, showcasing both strengths and weaknesses in the narratives they encounter. The user's appreciation for multifaceted characters and the broader historical context remains prominent, as does their incorporation of humor into critiques.
